[{'created': '2019-03-11 18:26:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failure to mount cephfs

Commit 2f6b1c6890cf7ea6b0dd33ac219646e4dcaf1fd6 changed the way the
cephfs source path was generated and dropped the source path component,
keeping only the list of IPs and ports. This results in failures to
mount cephfs with the following message:

    source mount path was not specified
    failed to resolve source

Change-Id: I94d18ec064971870264ae8d0b279564f2172e548
Closes-Bug: #1819502
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failure to mount cephfs

Commit 2f6b1c6890cf7ea6b0dd33ac219646e4dcaf1fd6 changed the way the
cephfs source path was generated and dropped the source path component,
keeping only the list of IPs and ports. This results in failures to
mount cephfs with the following message:

    source mount path was not specified
    failed to resolve source

Change-Id: I94d18ec064971870264ae8d0b279564f2172e548
Closes-Bug: #1819502

[{'created': '2019-03-11 12:13:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix installation of docker when docker-engine is not available

In such case docker.io should be installed. It happens e.g. on
Ubuntu 18.04.
In gate_hook script there was code to handle such case when
docker-engine isn't available but grep used there wasn't
very strict and it was passing because package
"golang-github-docker-engine-api-dev" matched results.

Now it will look only for "docker-engine" package and if it will
not be available, "docker.io" will be installed.

Change-Id: I805761ba4523e71a5aa06f6f6667e801184824df
Closes-Bug: #1818628
'}, {'created': '2019-03-11 13:04:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix installation of docker when docker-engine is not available

Ubuntu 18.04.
In gate_hook script there was code to handle such case when
docker-engine isn't available but grep used there wasn't
very strict and it was passing because package
"golang-github-docker-engine-api-dev" matched results.

Now it will look only for "docker-engine" package and if it will
not be available, "docker.io" will be installed.

Change-Id: I805761ba4523e71a5aa06f6f6667e801184824df
Closes-Bug: #1818628
'}]
commit_message:
Fix installation of docker when docker-engine is not available

In such case docker.io should be installed. It happens e.g. on
Ubuntu 18.04.
In gate_hook script there was code to handle such case when
docker-engine isn't available but grep used there wasn't
very strict and it was passing because package
"golang-github-docker-engine-api-dev" matched results.

Now it will look only for "docker-engine" package and if it will
not be available, "docker.io" will be installed.

Change-Id: I805761ba4523e71a5aa06f6f6667e801184824df
Closes-Bug: #1818628

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 09:53:19.000000000', 'message': "Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

For core openstack python projects it might make sense to
not split them apart and run them all together. For things like
TripleO/Kolla/Puppet/etc where we have layers of interactions that can
be affected by the results from the linters/unit jobs it makes
sense to split them out.

For example, in tripleo since we use packages, if the unit test fails
the integration test may fail because when we go to built the package
with the new source, the unit test int he package build fails.  Thus
we know that'll be a wasted execution and you won't actually get any
results.

An alternative Today:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration FAILURE
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

Future:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration SKIPPED
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

This may not be true for devstack but if the unit
tests are failing, then the code is likely bad (backwards
compatibility/wrong assumptions about change/etc) and we shouldn't be
running an actual deployment.

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I967ff0323756e63e9bd66049080dde2a870399fd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

NOTE: for example, standalone jobs are defined as a template in
tripleo-ci, and here we are adding and override the listed jobs for the
dependencies/files options. If a job is added to the standlone template
in tripleo-ci, we need to add the job and dependency here manually.
If we won't, that job will be consumed as is and run w/o dependencies.
That is the price to pay for not having overrides managed centrally in
tripleo-ci. The latter wouldn't work neither as a single template
cannot fit all the specific needs of numerous tripleo repos. So the
final call was made to manage overrides via local overrides for tripleo
repos.

For core openstack python projects it might make sense to
not split them apart and run them all together. For things like
TripleO/Kolla/Puppet/etc where we have layers of interactions that can
be affected by the results from the linters/unit jobs it makes
sense to split them out.

For example, in tripleo since we use packages, if the unit test fails
the integration test may fail because when we go to built the package
with the new source, the unit test int he package build fails.  Thus
we know that'll be a wasted execution and you won't actually get any
results.

An alternative Today:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration FAILURE
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

Future:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration SKIPPED
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

This may not be true for devstack but if the unit
tests are failing, then the code is likely bad (backwards
compatibility/wrong assumptions about change/etc) and we shouldn't be
running an actual deployment.

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I967ff0323756e63e9bd66049080dde2a870399fd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add tools to get keystone auth plugin

With directly provide auth string(with contain a json formate
with auth_type and auth info), we can release context to specific
auth_type and give user the ability to provide other Keystone
(or their own) authentication method (like using
`v3applicationcredential` or others).
The format for `auth` and `auth_type` follows exactly Keystone
plugins like in clouds.yaml file [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystoneauth/latest/
plugin-options.html#additional-loaders

Change-Id: Ic4dc2292a82860b9bb54ecb9e3b1a4dc806dab2c
Story: #2002126
Task: #26904

Fix metadata_settings for redis

this output. This fixes that.

commit_message:
Extend remove_version_from_href support

Improve remove_version_from_href so that it supports URLs for which
the version does not directly trail the hostname

Given: 'http://manila.example.com/share/v1.1/123'
Returns: 'http://manila.example.com/share/123'

Based on I8ccc449116ff164aacc0aefca3a0ec2ac8f73aa8

Change-Id: I13010d3ee0a83a67204145837503abe7126263cd
Closes-Bug: #1815038

commit_message:
Fix version selector when for proxy-style URLs

When manila API is served behind a proxy, the
"script_name" in the request can have the proxy
component in it. So, this patch fixes the version
selection logic by looking for the version in the
script name string instead of equivalence.

In addition, this patch adds some missing unit
tests and fixes tests that invoke a mocked
wsgi app for testing request context.

Change-Id: I0363d7174f3d7ddefa8ced59b182faed665e9c36
Partial-Bug: #1815038
Closes-Bug: #1818081

commit_message:
Adding NODEPOOL_DOCKER_REGISTRY_V2_PROXY

NODEPOOL_DOCKER_REGISTRY_V2_PROXY will be:
http://$NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST:8082/registry-1.docker/

Which is the URL of the mirror for the Docker Registry v2 provided by
Opendev Infra team.

Change-Id: I4ce6c8358af481c19577cd93d2f6941f1a8d0a15

commit_message:
Add a new directive to validate integer

The regular expression ^[0-9]+$ does not recognize the scientific notation,
so I added a new directive to verify the integer.

Change-Id: I3e5013d0c35b0960b55310d9f524e525f397f2b0
Closes-Bug: #1815705

commit_message:
Remove publish-loci post job

The publishing credentials for this job are misconfigured in Zuul and
result in the whole post pipeline failing, which causes tarballs not to
be updated on tarballs.openstack.org[1]. Remove the misconfigured job to
get the post pipeline working again.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2019-03-11

Change-Id: I4d94a433ba32bce7ee926cdde487eeec980c6b8b
(cherry picked from commit f0c2e798f7e706acbaf600bd06521a0e4c514477)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-27 11:10:44.000000000', 'message': "Use master upper-constraints when installing tempest plugins

when tempst venv is build, it use the master upper_contraint[1]
but when we install tempest plugin, it use branch upper_contraint.

This leads to mismatch the dependency version between tempest and required
tempest plugins setup.

Current flow after this change is:

1. install tempest form master (until you explicitly change TEMPEST_BRANCH
   which is default to master in all stable branch). It applies the upper_constraint
   from the stable branch but that will be overridden in step2
2. configure tempest, here the created venv will install all dependency with
   master's upper_constraint.
3. install tempest plugins in same venv created above. Now tempest plugin
   will also use the master upper_constraint.

With this tempest venv which has all enabled plugin will be contsraint with
master.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/72f632222f6d90d3545b5d7ca48297da4218e2ea/lib/tempest#L590

Change-Id: I89314e8391e8f26c622fc090cbe27997b3cf049a
Closes-Bug: #1816022
"}]
commit_message:
Use master upper-constraints when installing tempest plugins

when tempst venv is build, it use the master upper_contraint[1]
but when we install tempest plugin, it use branch upper_contraint.

This leads to mismatch the dependency version between tempest and required
tempest plugins setup.

Current flow after this change is:

1. install tempest form master (until you explicitly change TEMPEST_BRANCH
   which is default to master in all stable branch). It applies the upper_constraint
   from the stable branch but that will be overridden in step2
2. configure tempest, here the created venv will install all dependency with
   master's upper_constraint.
3. install tempest plugins in same venv created above. Now tempest plugin
   will also use the master upper_constraint.

With this tempest venv which has all enabled plugin will be contsraint with
master.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/72f632222f6d90d3545b5d7ca48297da4218e2ea/lib/tempest#L590

Change-Id: I89314e8391e8f26c622fc090cbe27997b3cf049a
Closes-Bug: #1816022

Rebuild to handle interface updates

There have been several interfaces in the layer-index

commit_message:
Rebuild to handle interface updates

There have been several interfaces in the layer-index
that were pointing to the openstack-charmers organization
rather than the openstack organization, and so built charms
have been missing updates to those interfaces. The index
has been updated in [1] and [2] so should now be up to date.

[1]: https://github.com/juju/layer-index/pull/65
[2]: https://github.com/juju/layer-index/pull/66

Change-Id: If7b1acb38c667ac006856b374e36b4b1a7d041bf

commit_message:
Revert "Fix python-chardet to latest version"

python2-chardet-3.0.4-7 is available in both rocky/stein RDO
CentOS/Fedora repositories. No need to install it from URL.

Renamed the python-chardet to python2-chardet, this is required
to install latest python2-chardet.

This reverts commit f59fde1485fcff9639c294524fee8455e401a568.

Change-Id: I0233b44924ebe072dcde3bc13bf5cb8dbb5998a7

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 01:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'DVR-HA: Unbinding a HA router from agent does not clear HA interface

Removing an active or a standby HA router from an agent that has a
valid DVR serviceable port (such as DHCP), does not remove the
HA interface associated with the Router in the SNAT namespace.

When we try to add the HA router back to the agent, then it
adds more than one HA interface to the SNAT Namespace causing
more problems and we sometimes also see multiple active routers.

This bug might have been introduced by this patch [1].

Fix the problem by just adding the router namespaces without HA
interfaces when there is no HA and re-insert the HA interfaces
when HA router is bound to the agent into the namespace.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522362/
Closes-Bug: #1816698

Change-Id: Ie625abcb73f8185bb2bee06dcd26a01d8af0b0d1
(cherry picked from commit d9e0bab6acf6a608ed5bf32524c7d362f052a3ac)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522362/

(cherry picked from commit d9e0bab6acf6a608ed5bf32524c7d362f052a3ac)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR-HA: Unbinding a HA router from agent does not clear HA interface

Removing an active or a standby HA router from an agent that has a
valid DVR serviceable port (such as DHCP), does not remove the
HA interface associated with the Router in the SNAT namespace.

When we try to add the HA router back to the agent, then it
adds more than one HA interface to the SNAT Namespace causing
more problems and we sometimes also see multiple active routers.

This bug might have been introduced by this patch [1].

Fix the problem by just adding the router namespaces without HA
interfaces when there is no HA and re-insert the HA interfaces
when HA router is bound to the agent into the namespace.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522362/
Closes-Bug: #1816698

Change-Id: Ie625abcb73f8185bb2bee06dcd26a01d8af0b0d1
(cherry picked from commit d9e0bab6acf6a608ed5bf32524c7d362f052a3ac)

commit_message:
Remove quota_db backward compat file

It's been four years since neutron.db.quota_db was changed
to really use neutron.db.quota.driver under the covers, let's
remove it now that all Openstack consumers have been updated.
There are other occurences besides below, but they are only
doc changes so will not be broken.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/639829 (neutron-lbaas)
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/639837 (tempest)
Change-Id: I948356c34e2bff5ca10fd1e3481762de0be62555

[{'created': '2019-03-12 14:44:24.000000000', 'message': "[CI][pylint] Bump timeout for pylint job

The base pylint 'tox' job assumes
the test only runs once, and sets a conservative
timeout of secs.

In manila, pre Stein release, we run pylint
twice to check for changes introduced in a
given patch vs the baseline. So we need more time.

Change-Id: I97643381806ef224a05947278673202c490b4c4b
"}]
commit_message:
[CI][pylint] Bump timeout for pylint job

The base pylint 'tox' job assumes
the test only runs once, and sets a conservative
timeout of secs.

In manila, pre Stein release, we run pylint
twice to check for changes introduced in a
given patch vs the baseline. So we need more time.

Change-Id: I97643381806ef224a05947278673202c490b4c4b

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-29 15:03:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-03-12 14:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM, thanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 15:03:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic22596fe76e2c581323ecadb3723336668e55623
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic22596fe76e2c581323ecadb3723336668e55623
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
py3: Fix return type on CooperativeReader.read

This should always be bytes; previously there was a path that returned an empty
native string.

Change-Id: I1cb4997cd3e766f9a7aea41ebe41a73971496bc3
Closes-Bug: #1818919

commit_message:
Set proxy-initial-not-pooled to 1

According to the samples that I've found, one needs to set a non-null
value here in order for the option to take effect. This is a follow-up
to [0].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/623597

Change-Id: I59bbc2874aaeab02ec331ff2318fb913d0435e1e
Closes-Bug: #1807518

commit_message:
Correct 'liminous' typo for puppet-ceph

When the puppet-stable jobs were fixed [1]
the attempt to override the checkout of master
branch of puppet-ceph was ineffective because
of a typo, so fix it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612481

Change-Id: I513a430029d6976c49155e4f707ff2d19e427c10

commit_message:
Run luminous jobs for stable/queens

In stable/queens ceph mimic is not yet supported but
scenario0004 jobs were defined to run with mimic.  They
passed because of a typo that is fixed here [1] but
will now fail unless shifted back to luminous.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642219/

Change-Id: I795848e9b9542954426218c647787ddf5c4678e5

commit_message:
monitor socat subprocess

Rather than calling socat directly, spawn a
ironic.util.process_supervisor.Supervisor instance to monitor the socat
process.  This will take care of (a) calling 'sol deactivate' when the
socat process exits, and (b) restarting the socat process.

Change-Id: Ied9f7fc7400b3adc9459d54622564d312a655c00
Story: #2005191
Task: #29951

[{'created': '2019-03-06 19:38:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add iSCSI to nova-compute AppArmor profile

When nova-compute is deployed with AppArmor in enforce mode, it
fails to attach iSCSI volumes because it is being blocked.

This patch fixes that by updating the nova-compute AppArmor profile
to include the commands, paths and capabilities used to attach
iSCSI volumes.

commit_message:
Add iSCSI to nova-compute AppArmor profile

When nova-compute is deployed with AppArmor in enforce mode, it
fails to attach iSCSI volumes because it is being blocked.

This patch fixes that by updating the nova-compute AppArmor profile
to include the commands, paths and capabilities used to attach
iSCSI volumes.

Change-Id: I46b8a8453cdc045f10850958652af920c8a19660
Closes-bug: #1815519
(cherry picked from commit ad8b38884e63ec31852031980dca94977a42b315)

commit_message:
Use setuptools instead of distribute (which is part of devel)

By building the package with setuptools, we ensure it is compatible
with pip 10 and above which require file manifests to be packaged.

Change-Id: I6da38bad79128a66ef2f4e4929529769cc36f916

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-04 10:00:12.000000000', 'message': "Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

For core openstack python projects it might make sense to
not split them apart and run them all together. For things like
TripleO/Kolla/Puppet/etc where we have layers of interactions that can
be affected by the results from the linters/unit jobs it makes
sense to split them out.

For example, in tripleo since we use packages, if the unit test fails
the integration test may fail because when we go to built the package
with the new source, the unit test int he package build fails.  Thus
we know that'll be a wasted execution and you won't actually get any
results.

An alternative Today:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration FAILURE
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

Future:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration SKIPPED
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

This may not be true for devstack but if the unit
tests are failing, then the code is likely bad (backwards
compatibility/wrong assumptions about change/etc) and we shouldn't be
running an actual deployment.

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I0799a50adbc253100fa69a54277c447680d2b3e2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-03-04 10:04:38.000000000', 'message': "Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

For core openstack python projects it might make sense to
not split them apart and run them all together. For things like
TripleO/Kolla/Puppet/etc where we have layers of interactions that can
be affected by the results from the linters/unit jobs it makes
sense to split them out.

For example, in tripleo since we use packages, if the unit test fails
the integration test may fail because when we go to built the package
with the new source, the unit test int he package build fails.  Thus
we know that'll be a wasted execution and you won't actually get any
results.

An alternative Today:

    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration FAILURE
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:

  patchset two:

  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

This may not be true for devstack but if the unit
tests are failing, then the code is likely bad (backwards

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/

* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I0799a50adbc253100fa69a54277c447680d2b3e2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-03-05 15:23:34.000000000', 'message': "Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

NOTE: for example, standalone jobs are defined as a template in
tripleo-ci, and here we are adding and override the listed jobs for the
dependencies/files options. If a job is added to the standlone template
in tripleo-ci, we need to add the job and dependency here manually.
If we won't, that job will be consumed as is and run w/o dependencies.
That is the price to pay for not having overrides managed centrally in
tripleo-ci. The latter wouldn't work neither as a single template
cannot fit all the specific needs of numerous tripleo repos. So the
final call was made to manage overrides via local overrides for tripleo
repos.

For core openstack python projects it might make sense to
not split them apart and run them all together. For things like
TripleO/Kolla/Puppet/etc where we have layers of interactions that can
be affected by the results from the linters/unit jobs it makes
sense to split them out.

For example, in tripleo since we use packages, if the unit test fails
the integration test may fail because when we go to built the package
with the new source, the unit test int he package build fails.  Thus
we know that'll be a wasted execution and you won't actually get any
results.

An alternative Today:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration FAILURE
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

Future:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration SKIPPED
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

This may not be true for devstack but if the unit
tests are failing, then the code is likely bad (backwards
compatibility/wrong assumptions about change/etc) and we shouldn't be
running an actual deployment.

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I0799a50adbc253100fa69a54277c447680d2b3e2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Delay check CI jobs until the pep8/unit passes..

..for Greater Good.
Save CI resources and shorten wait-in-zuul-queue times
for other patches, when tox/pep8 checks failed.

NOTE: for example, standalone jobs are defined as a template in
tripleo-ci, and here we are adding and override the listed jobs for the
dependencies/files options. If a job is added to the standlone template
in tripleo-ci, we need to add the job and dependency here manually.
If we won't, that job will be consumed as is and run w/o dependencies.
That is the price to pay for not having overrides managed centrally in
tripleo-ci. The latter wouldn't work neither as a single template
cannot fit all the specific needs of numerous tripleo repos. So the
final call was made to manage overrides via local overrides for tripleo
repos.

For core openstack python projects it might make sense to
not split them apart and run them all together. For things like
TripleO/Kolla/Puppet/etc where we have layers of interactions that can
be affected by the results from the linters/unit jobs it makes
sense to split them out.

For example, in tripleo since we use packages, if the unit test fails
the integration test may fail because when we go to built the package
with the new source, the unit test int he package build fails.  Thus
we know that'll be a wasted execution and you won't actually get any
results.

An alternative Today:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration FAILURE
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

Future:
  patchset one:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest FAILURE
    integration SKIPPED
  patchset two:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration FAILURE
  patchset three:
    pep8 SUCCESS
    unittest SUCCESS
    integration SUCCESS

This may not be true for devstack but if the unit
tests are failing, then the code is likely bad (backwards
compatibility/wrong assumptions about change/etc) and we shouldn't be
running an actual deployment.

Related upstream ML threads:
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html
* http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/
2019-February/003142.html

Change-Id: I0799a50adbc253100fa69a54277c447680d2b3e2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set setype on etcd's service directory

Set correct setype so the Etcd service has permission to chown its
own service directory (/var/lib/etcd).

Change-Id: I065952d76efcc7434852f538ec56c7db94ce4524

commit_message:
Install and configure tmpwatch for log cleanup

Installing and configuring tmpwatch allows to get rid of some
ugly things in logrotate configuration. As the container has no
network access anymore, we have to install the tool on the host
directly - this isn't that bad.

In order to avoid issues with logrotate manage logs, we explicitely
exclude patterns manage in the specific logorate configuration.

Also, always in order to avoid issues and ensure logrotate does its
own cleanup, we clean files one day later.

Change-Id: Ic666388d9ba7556e7b68ab2fc1082957a9e26552

commit_message:
Configure switchdev mode in SR-IOV in os-net-config

While sriov vfs are created now using os-net-config,
so doing some modification to configure switchdev mode there

Closes-Bug: #1818034
(cherry picked from commit 3dcad07311be36161529069fdd14107aa2142ee2)

Conflicts:
	os_net_config/objects.py
	os_net_config/schema.yaml

Change-Id: I7c85ab380dc4f0377a65fc954fcce3e3d39f5029
Signed-off-by: waleed mousa <waleedm@mellanox.com>

at the same time.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582285/ for more details.

Closes-Bug: #1782147
Change-Id: Iec6cda460d1e3ed6ec4efa28c52a263876facbc1
'}]
commit_message:
Deploy Sahara with unversioned endpoints

Sahara supports unversioned endpoint also for the current API v1.1,
and deploying with unversioned endpoints is a better setting
if people want to use both API v1.1 and the (soon-stable) API v2
at the same time.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582285/ for more details.

Closes-Bug: #1782147
Change-Id: Iec6cda460d1e3ed6ec4efa28c52a263876facbc1

commit_message:
Disable designate worker service

[1] enabled designate worker by default, designate
worker and designate pool manager cannot be started
together. Until puppet-designate is fixed to handle
this scenario, this patch disables designate
worker explicitly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/434355/

Change-Id: Iba2d9cf60e09b11bcd0bd956c49229a91abd27fc

Nova commands such as "hypervisor-list --matching <substring>",
host-evacuate-live and host-evacuate and few more, treat the
user-specified "host-name" as the input to the HTTP
/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_hostname_pattern}/search API.

Nova checks "host-name" as a pattern instead of exact match,
which causes problem with some commands such as
nova host-evacuate-live compute-1 where in host-evacuate
action will apply to all "compute-1", "compute-10".
That is not right.
Correcting it by using exact match.

commit_message:
Nova treats hostname as pattern

Nova commands such as "hypervisor-list --matching <substring>",
host-evacuate-live and host-evacuate and few more, treat the
user-specified "host-name" as the input to the HTTP
/os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_hostname_pattern}/search API.

Nova checks "host-name" as a pattern instead of exact match,
which causes problem with some commands such as
nova host-evacuate-live compute-1 where in host-evacuate
action will apply to all "compute-1", "compute-10".
That is not right.
Correcting it by using exact match.

Change-Id: I1ad2514a86ac2e7f764f64feae7e338cdb744199
Closes-Bug: #1667794

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-14 13:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Allow force-delete to delete instance in
task_state block_device_mapping

Check task_state of the instance when using force-delete command and
then delete the instance even if it is in block_device_mapping state

Change-Id: I645c4927eb3bf38e6d5ba887c94cb40a57199796
Closes-bug: #1704945

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-26 14:34:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add PF PCI ID to port binding profile

Currently Physical PCI information for SRIOV ports is not recorded
in binding profile.

This patch adds pf_pci_slot to the port binding profile.

Change-Id: Idf346de3301ed49b4bddfa59d1ae09e076919f64
Implements: blueprint add-physical-pci-info-for-sriov-ports
'}]
commit_message:
Add PF PCI ID to port binding profile

Currently Physical PCI information for SRIOV ports is not recorded
in binding profile.

This patch adds pf_pci_slot to the port binding profile.

Change-Id: Idf346de3301ed49b4bddfa59d1ae09e076919f64
Implements: blueprint add-physical-pci-info-for-sriov-ports

commit_message:
quotas of instance in soft-delete vm_state

Now instance in soft-delete vm_state releases the user's quota,
but does not release the instance's resources until period task
"_reclaim_queued_deletes" runs with a period of
reclaim_instance_interval seconds.

This patch changes to set the instance in soft-delete vm_state
occupied user's quota, then, release quotas when instance is
deleted complete.

Change-Id: Ic84abf93e1152e1cbb3defc3adaebae17de07dc2
Closes-Bug: 1501808

commit_message:
Create cmd/script that prints JSON Schema of Notification Payload Classes

This change depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411822/.
Currently, there is an issue where Object fields that are nullable can cause
Exceptions when the get_schema() method is called.

implements bp json-schema-for-versioned-notifications

Depends-On: I43b04a76cccc9d4f893162535050fed6940bee6c

Change-Id: Icce7a4c0ecbdf109132ceb901d0f1c141badbfe3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-12 12:24:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reporting when package version is unset

When a package tracks a stable branch rather than release, the spec file
doesn't contain a specific version number and so the status tool usually
reports it as "{{ py2rpmversion() }}" which gets converted to a Version
object that uses version 0.0. This causes the report to make it appear
like this packages need to be upgraded, but in reality no changes are
needed because they automatically track the branch. This change detects
versions like this and reports them as "ok" instead of "needs upgrade".

Change-Id: Ia1191c6c0938e78d8824cb8d893d561ddd99de4a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reporting when package version is unset

When a package tracks a stable branch rather than release, the spec file
doesn't contain a specific version number and so the status tool usually
reports it as "{{ py2rpmversion() }}" which gets converted to a Version
object that uses version 0.0. This causes the report to make it appear
like this packages need to be upgraded, but in reality no changes are
needed because they automatically track the branch. This change detects
versions like this and reports them as "ok" instead of "needs upgrade".

Change-Id: Ia1191c6c0938e78d8824cb8d893d561ddd99de4a

commit_message:
Always run mon relation after handling broker request

This must be done to make sure the individual unit relation data
is in sync.

Change-Id: Ibf51766c868c179fa1b3245b394e32d0f2e7c1ab

[{'created': '2017-06-26 03:42:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add refresh connection info in rollback live migration

pre_live_migration will initialize volume connection and update bdm in
db, if live migration failed the connection info will not be set back.

commit_message:
Add refresh connection info in rollback live migration

pre_live_migration will initialize volume connection and update bdm in
db, if live migration failed the connection info will not be set back.
This patch trys to rollback the connection info at source.

Change-Id: Id5a55ebe0354b780a6b73ea919456ed8c0708b24
Signed-off-by: Liu Qing <liuqing@chinac.com>

commit_message:
Expand feature matrix with server admin actions

Added admin actions under nova/doc/source/feature_matrix_admin.ini
Added details for:
1. Swap volumes
2. Service control
3. Restore instance
4. Server create backup
5. Live migrate server

Change-Id: Ib4345e631ff4c8ac69ca0ed83815296f2a55f077
Implements: blueprint feature-classification-pike

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-09 00:07:56.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve amphora agent read timeout issue

Occasionally the test jobs[1] will fail with:
octavia.amphorae.drivers.haproxy.rest_api_driver [-]
Could not connect to instance. Read timed out. (read timeout=120.0)

This patch increases the default read timeout to 180 and changes the
directory copy that would subsequently fail to be more idempotent.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/09/613709/14/check/ \
octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-two-node/d83db12/controller2/logs/ \
screen-o-cw.txt.gz#_Feb_08_21_58_23_919928

Change-Id: Ia0bd6762c2605ce240a549b3e90e5c44b65897a5

commit_message:
Resolve amphora agent read timeout issue

Occasionally the test jobs[1] will fail with:
octavia.amphorae.drivers.haproxy.rest_api_driver [-]
Could not connect to instance. Read timed out. (read timeout=120.0)

This patch increases the default read timeout to 180 and changes the
directory copy that would subsequently fail to be more idempotent.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/09/613709/14/check/ \
octavia-v2-dsvm-scenario-two-node/d83db12/controller2/logs/ \
screen-o-cw.txt.gz#_Feb_08_21_58_23_919928

[{'created': '2019-03-05 12:25:20.000000000', 'message': 'Keep the system locale in the openstack command.

By default puppet reset the locale to "C"[1].  This can cause problem
when openstack command have to deal with non ascii strings.

We use the override_locale parameter of the execute puppet method to
pass down the locale to the openstack command.

Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>
Closes-Bug: #1744075

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L349-L357

Change-Id: Ia61308d54be4a72faf47b315989b63dc8f64aa09
'}, {'created': '2019-03-05 12:52:44.000000000', 'message': 'Keep the system locale in the openstack command.

By default puppet reset the locale to "C"[1].  This can cause problem
when openstack command have to deal with non ascii strings.

We use the override_locale parameter of the execute puppet method to
pass down the locale to the openstack command.

Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>
Closes-Bug: #1744075

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L349-L357

commit_message:
Keep the system locale in the openstack command.

By default puppet reset the locale to "C"[1].  This can cause problem
when openstack command have to deal with non ascii strings.

We use the override_locale parameter of the execute puppet method to
pass down the locale to the openstack command.

Co-Authored-By: Natal Ngétal <hobbestigrou@erakis.eu>
Closes-Bug: #1744075

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppet/blob/master/lib/puppet/util/execution.rb#L349-L357

Change-Id: Ia61308d54be4a72faf47b315989b63dc8f64aa09

[{'created': '2019-03-11 09:44:24.000000000', 'message': 'Spawn metadata proxy on dvr ha standby routers

In case when L3 agent is running in dvr_snat mode on compute node,
it is like that e.g. in some of the gate jobs, it may happen that
same router is scheduled to be in standby mode on compute node and
on same compute node there is instance connected to it.
So in such case metadata proxy needs to be spawned in router namespace
even if it is in standby mode.

Change-Id: Id646ab2c184c7a1d5ac38286a0162dd37d72df6e
Closes-Bug: #1817956
Closes-Bug: #1606741
(cherry picked from commit 6ae228cc2e75504d9a8f35e3480a66707f9d7246)
'}]
commit_message:
Spawn metadata proxy on dvr ha standby routers

In case when L3 agent is running in dvr_snat mode on compute node,
it is like that e.g. in some of the gate jobs, it may happen that
same router is scheduled to be in standby mode on compute node and
on same compute node there is instance connected to it.
So in such case metadata proxy needs to be spawned in router namespace
even if it is in standby mode.

Change-Id: Id646ab2c184c7a1d5ac38286a0162dd37d72df6e
Closes-Bug: #1817956
Closes-Bug: #1606741
(cherry picked from commit 6ae228cc2e75504d9a8f35e3480a66707f9d7246)

commit_message:
Deprecate VolumeDetail and BackupDetail classes

We have introduced altering base_path for operations on resources. 
Volumes and Backups were not switched to this new method and were still 
relying on returning inherited classes VolumeDetail and BackupDetail. 
This change allow doing any supported operation on a resource returned 
by list immediately without any conversion or re-fetch.

Change-Id: Ia095c53f1d04f1c119c6a6f8a38c5bfd60dc8a67

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

Story: #2004627
Task: #29701
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This review should result in no functional change.

Change-Id: I366b7a32aeedbd76d49c763b31ff4ec0b049190e
Story: #2004627
Task: #29701

commit_message:
Mark fullstack test_dscp_marking_packets as unstable

According to related bug report, this test is failing recently
quite often and we don't know the root cause of those failures
yet.
Lets mark this test as unstable for now to make our gates
more happy and give us some more time to debug this issue.

Change-Id: Id67c6095299c375d30ab557183bc2e45322893cb
Related-Bug: #1818335

commit_message:
Add qdrouterd role for rpc messaging backend deployment

This patch introduces the qdrouterd role for deployment as
a direct messaging bus for oslo.messaging rpc communications.
The qdrouterd is deployed as infrastructure in a manner similar
to the rabbitmq server.

This patch:
* Add to role requirements
* Add to inventory
* Add to playbooks
* Add experimental aio job

Change-Id: If9eed3d5848939eac005651336a1305433d96dbf

This is useful to store tracepoints in a database.

Adding python 3.6 unit test

Adding python 3.6 openstack job to templates, adding py36 to
tox environments and reordering the template jobs.

Change-Id: Ib6269b0d686babfd7973503baa9189efe402e2d8

commit_message:
Fix ansible lint and ubuntu deployment

This patch combines two different fixes, since both are required to get
CI tests passing.

1. Fix ansible lint 301 with ip link set dev <device> up

This resolves:

[301] Commands should not change things if nothing needs doing
/home/will/code/tenks/ansible/roles/veth-pair/tasks/present.yml:13
Task/Handler: Bring each end of veth up

ip link set dev <device> up is idempotent:

https://github.com/shemminger/iproute2/blob/707f612c00a91fe3c17d7af5319e423545a496c5/ip/iplink.c#L264
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/63bdf4284c38a48af21745ceb148a087b190cd21/net/core/rtnetlink.c#L2485
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/63bdf4284c38a48af21745ceb148a087b190cd21/net/core/dev.c#L7632
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/63bdf4284c38a48af21745ceb148a087b190cd21/net/core/dev.c#L7563

2. Add pkg-config as an explicit dependency

This is to fix the following error:

Exception: pkg-config binary is required to compile libvirt-python

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9a2db7b5f2cbdcb64227bd4f1de245bcb7f71f5b

commit_message:
Mark dvr_ha_router_failover tests as unstable

According to related bug, those tests are now failing
quite often due to reasons described in bug report.
Lets mark them as unstable for now to make our gate
more stable until we will fix those tests in proper way.

Change-Id: Id803f2d23375a73322dbcc7337480d28c33cea82
Related-Bug: #1819160

commit_message:
Use oslo_serialization instead of the json module directly

* Always use oslo jsonutils.
* Consistently import jsonutils as-is.
* Use dump_as_bytes instead of dumps.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Serialization:_base64.2C_JSON.2C_etc.

Change-Id: Ia58b2a6a8740fa7f0796b05e14e812d5240c7acc

commit_message:
Fix deploy template tests on Rocky and earlier

Version 1.54 is from Stein, we cannot use it on older versions. We actually
don't need to specify it, since the lowest version is used by default.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642435/
Change-Id: I8edff72f869d83ff7f192f43a3236a634c294e2b

'}, {'created': '2018-11-03 20:59:37.000000000', 'message': 'Switch devstack plugin to samltest.id

testshib.org is no longer maintained and has been broken for some
time[1]. Use the new samltest.id provider instead.

This is not a permanent solution, this is a stopgap measure until we
configure our own IdP in the devstack plugin.

commit_message:
Switch devstack plugin to samltest.id

testshib.org is no longer maintained and has been broken for some
time[1]. Use the new samltest.id provider instead.

This is not a permanent solution, this is a stopgap measure until we
configure our own IdP in the devstack plugin.

[1] https://marc.info/?l=shibboleth-users&m=154056288800549&w=2

Change-Id: Ifa514395d9cdb2197ef8a43885ec598483dd7a38

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: Icbc1fab92895e1f70a2aedf9507491a1b789f205
(cherry picked from commit 20f3ae971d37f3a26ee8aa079e2fd3e6d7ca43aa)

commit_message:
Document os_tempest configuration options

The review adds documentation of configuration options regarding
python-tempestconf.
The change is part of adding user documentation process, see
https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/583

Change-Id: Iee91ed5bcf5cf5db3df42e9cd40178b10f1c38f8

Backup drivers were migrated from backup services around Havana with

still loading the old path names and cleans up a mapping dict that
wasn't even being used anymore.

commit_message:
Drop legacy backup service support

Backup drivers were migrated from backup services around Havana with
Ic3fca567111f4bd1b221689c73cd5c3bab4a777b. This removes support for
still loading the old path names and cleans up a mapping dict that
wasn't even being used anymore.

Support for loading by class name and not module name was deprecated in
queen with Id6bee9e7d0da8ead224a04f86fe79ddfb5b286cf. This removes that
capability and requires that the backup driver class name is provided.

Change-Id: I3ada2dee1857074746b1893b82dd5f6641c6e579
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix ansible lint 301 with ip link set dev <device> up

This resolves:

[301] Commands should not change things if nothing needs doing
/home/will/code/tenks/ansible/roles/veth-pair/tasks/present.yml:13
Task/Handler: Bring each end of veth up

ip link set dev <device> up is idempotent:

https://github.com/shemminger/iproute2/blob/707f612c00a91fe3c17d7af5319e423545a496c5/ip/iplink.c#L264
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/63bdf4284c38a48af21745ceb148a087b190cd21/net/core/rtnetlink.c#L2485
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/63bdf4284c38a48af21745ceb148a087b190cd21/net/core/dev.c#L7632
https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/63bdf4284c38a48af21745ceb148a087b190cd21/net/core/dev.c#L7563

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Icd77e1c058156de0be7d663377a6c875f8a18a42

Introduce 'get_pip' macro

We have code for it in four places so it is a good candidate for macro.

commit_message:
Fix python-chardet to latest version

Since we cant install this from repo because
it's a SRPM which has to be pulled in from
another openstack package we do this for now.

Change-Id: I68b8c09504500bafca259a58e62b0779c0bd6253

commit_message:
[doc] Add network segment ranges into admin guide

Add a new networking guide section for "Network segment ranges" into
admin guide.

Co-authored-by: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: I22fd32627d732b3bac9fc7d58e58a13784fda5f1

commit_message:
Remove VolumeBackupRestoreIntegrationTest from skip list

We cannot run this test in the gate because the volume backup feature is
enabled. However, with a change to the Heat tempest plugin to allow this
feature to be automatically skipped based on the tempest config, we no
longer need this test to be explicitly included in the skip list.

Change-Id: Iaefa5c272c4322498330307ea9bd6843d276ef1b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/632989

commit_message:
Customized confirm message

When an action needs double confirm from users, it will be great if we
can have an API to specify customized confirmation message. This can help
to provide more detailed information (any warnings and consequences) of
the action to the users.

Closes-Bug: 1815421

Change-Id: I3918d724a3689bd5eb24df955e62bad71353e333
Signed-off-by: Yan Chen <yan.chen@intel.com>

[{'created': '2019-02-19 08:51:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for unable to create swift containers when enabled CSRF cookie secure setting

This commit is to add CRSF token to the default POST ajax request headers,
when trying to create swift containers for the case CSRF_COOKIE_HTTPONLY is
enabled under https environment.

Closes-Bug: 1816532

Change-Id: I75858026d9353715bf456ee5785759e089efc5fe
Signed-off-by: Yan Chen <yan.chen@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for unable to create swift containers when enabled CSRF cookie secure setting

This commit is to add CRSF token to the default POST ajax request headers,
when trying to create swift containers for the case CSRF_COOKIE_HTTPONLY is
enabled under https environment.

Closes-Bug: 1816532

Change-Id: I75858026d9353715bf456ee5785759e089efc5fe
Signed-off-by: Yan Chen <yan.chen@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 12:28:33.000000000', 'message': 'Check microversions before validations for allocations and deploy templates

Currently we check them after the input is checked, which allows leaking the API
to older versions. This patch fixes it by moving the checks to the _route call.
Additional unit tests are added for this case.

Change-Id: Iccd14ed1c4c9f0c03cb1156f184519ad358905dc
'}]
commit_message:
Check microversions before validations for allocations and deploy templates

Currently we check them after the input is checked, which allows leaking the API
to older versions. This patch fixes it by moving the checks to the _route call.
Additional unit tests are added for this case.

Change-Id: Iccd14ed1c4c9f0c03cb1156f184519ad358905dc

commit_message:
Copy tripleo-admin key to mistral home directory

This provides an authentication mechanism for the mistral-executor
container ansible playbooks to ssh out to the undercloud host.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638316/
Change-Id: Iafddad4da9c4cf80a6e25836c207c60f9ad7ffee

commit_message:
Follow up patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/640990

That enables py3 execution of Storlet application.
This patch addresses Takashi's comment on there,
plus missing protocol issue between gateway and daemon_factory.

Change-Id: Ia4170fdb46e6ceae6de8a1eb03d7da6a922612b7

commit_message:
os-testr: Remove dependency on testrepository

Starting with 1.0 testrepository has been dropped and
it uses stestr only

Change-Id: Id0086283213be687d6fc8a64babe7e0543d5aea6
(cherry picked from commit 66238b2b4ce248aca97fa07d955217ae1dfac855)

commit_message:
Use setuptools instead of distribute (which is part of devel)

By building the package with setuptools, we ensure it is compatible
with pip 10 and above which require file manifests to be packaged.

Change-Id: Id4461b5437f0e8592bc8c3ba9581344477a34876

to display status of the notification.

commit_message:
Mark enable_ui as deprecated

The TripleO UI is deprecated and will be removed in Train.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641743/
Change-Id: I6eb0686b58bd3bca0c8be128583c0f07c04ce31a

[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-03-07 17:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-03-07 18:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If we already know that the UI isn't maintained in Stein, we should patch the existing service to remove the container *anyway* (the tripleo-container-rm won't fail if the container doesn't exist)."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-03-07 20:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-07 22:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-03-07 22:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-03-11 14:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-11 16:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-03-11 21:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 17:53:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add disabled tripleo ui service

In order to remove the container, we need to be able to disable the
service without defining it. This change creates a disable version of
the tripleo-ui service which will just remove tripleo-ui on upgrades.

Change-Id: I2bbe81a251f7cb626ccc4499f4e38379a94bdac0
'}, {'created': '2019-03-07 20:53:08.000000000', 'message': "Disable TripleO UI service

TripleO ui is most likely going to be unmaintained in Stein so let's
just set the service to clean it self up on the upgrade and not actually
try and deploy the container.

Change-Id: I2bbe81a251f7cb626ccc4499f4e38379a94bdac0
"}]
commit_message:
Disable TripleO UI service

TripleO ui is most likely going to be unmaintained in Stein so let's
just set the service to clean it self up on the upgrade and not actually
try and deploy the container.

Change-Id: I2bbe81a251f7cb626ccc4499f4e38379a94bdac0

commit_message:
Add policy configuration howto

Explain the cinder user model and how policies can be used
to configure API call access.  Includes a detailed example
of how to configure a read-only administrator.

It fails because I have two accounts (not sure I even remember why). What do I do? Should I change the file name to something else?


http://logs.openstack.org/36/642336/1/check/election-tox-ci-checks-review/e520091/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-03-11_05_07_32_765632'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-03-11 13:46:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck

A bit of research shows that the 21051 account has uploaded no changes (unsurprising as it also doesn't have a username) and only seems to show up as a reviewer on changes where others have mistakenly requested it:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/owner:21051
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/reviewer:21051

The older 8731 account, on the other hand, has been pushing changes and reviewing the changes of others so is almost certainly the account you're using. In light of this, I've marked 21051 inactive in Gerrit and rechecked this change to get updated job results."}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2019-03-11 14:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Candidacy is valid.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-03-11 14:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

is redundant and may be misleading.

commit_message:
Create two loop devices for bluestore and filestore

The ceph-loop-device role was changed [1] to create an
LVM structure on the loop device but only for versions
which can use that structure for bluestore. However,
the zuul.branch variable doesn't work as expected to
differentiate versions so remove the code that uses it.

In place of switching on the version create two loop
devices, then legacy jobs which don't support LVM can
use the loop device without LVM. Call the legacy loop
device /dev/loop3 so older jobs get the expected name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637196

Change-Id: I778bf3d78ccf492e852a2c932ccd5e8266bcfe71
Related-Bug: #1817688

Unless RDO is removing these packages I see no reason to remove a service we have support for ATM.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2019-03-04 12:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-06 16:33:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-03-11 18:59:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Workflow

In the case of Congress, I see no value on keeping it, even as experimental service. I haven't seen any kind of interest in this service, nobody asked for it in my knowledge and no bug report was filed on the existing code. I suggest we just remove it."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-03-11 21:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does no-bug reports mean it just works, so no-one complains. Or that no-one is using it. Should we pop an e-mail to the list with [servicename] + [tripleo] tag and ask? It could also be turned into a question if someone is willing to maintain it either as supported or in a non-support/experimental tree as discussed on the mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2019-03-11 21:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove Congress

Congress doesn't seem to be used anywhere, we never had a bug report or
any sign of somebody out there actually using it.

Let's remove its support in TripleO, to reduce the codebase.

Change-Id: Idca6b12f1c0ca3bc15bedf6469d4063a4dac31fa

commit_message:
DNM: inline fake_libvirt_utils.create_image mocks

Replace fake_libvirt_utils.create_image with test method-level mocks
where actually needed.

NOTE: When fake_libvirt_utils goes away, these mocks will have to be
touched again to mock the methods out of libvirt_utils itself.

Change-Id: I80fa130e08801777afc4ae3a45a146122de6e637

[{'created': '2019-02-27 13:07:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters

Change I12859167d19b9f40e3378ac08fed094a42f40bc7
put the evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters inside an
{% if } block that it wasn't meant to be inside. As a consequence,
that setting would be ignored more often that it would be
honored.

The Queens version of this patch must retain the "## Cinder API's
enabled" section that the patch in master removes, since Queens does
still support the cinder_enable_v{1,2,3}_api options.

Change-Id: Ic5707615571e62ba2326e2ad436333bac246c8dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters

Change I12859167d19b9f40e3378ac08fed094a42f40bc7
put the evaluation of cinder_scheduler_default_filters inside an
{% if } block that it wasn't meant to be inside. As a consequence,
that setting would be ignored more often that it would be
honored.

The Queens version of this patch must retain the "## Cinder API's
enabled" section that the patch in master removes, since Queens does
still support the cinder_enable_v{1,2,3}_api options.

Change-Id: Ic5707615571e62ba2326e2ad436333bac246c8dd

commit_message:
Update docs bug links to storyboard

Update doc, api-ref and releasenotes conf.py to set 'use_storyboard' to
True. According to the docs of the theme [1] bug project and tag are
not used when using StoryBoard.

doc/requirements.txt (used by all the docs-related jobs) is updated
to make openstackdocstheme>=1.24.0. That version is the most recent
one to have bug fixes related to use_storyboard.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/openstackdocstheme/latest/#using-the-theme

Change-Id: I3b28dd1da9e8e75eda151a3025e78a5a47c971f9
Story: 2005190
Task: 29948

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 14:10:01.000000000', 'message': "Handle templated cell mappings in nova-status

The nova-status upgrade check code is intentionally written
to not use versioned objects and just work with the data model
directly.

However, CellMapping database_connection template support was
added in Rocky and the template URL is only formatted when using
the object on read from the database, which means if you are using
a template for the database_connection nova-status will break since
the get_engine() code is getting a template string rather than a
properly formatted URL.

This change fixes the bug by using the CellMapping object code to
pull the mappings from the database which will format the database
connection URL. Note that we cannot simply update the sqlalchemy
RowProxy objects we get normally since those are read-only, and
because of how the mappings are used as objects with attribute
access rather than as a dict we cannot just convert the RowProxy
to a dict - we would have to put it in some kind of object for
attribute access and if we are going to do that we might as well
just use the CellMapping objects we have so that's what we do in
this change.

Change-Id: I5ce175517f6feb6e82ba507078a565b71427a4b0
Closes-Bug: #1818047
"}]
commit_message:
Handle templated cell mappings in nova-status

The nova-status upgrade check code is intentionally written
to not use versioned objects and just work with the data model
directly.

However, CellMapping database_connection template support was
added in Rocky and the template URL is only formatted when using
the object on read from the database, which means if you are using
a template for the database_connection nova-status will break since
the get_engine() code is getting a template string rather than a
properly formatted URL.

This change fixes the bug by using the CellMapping object code to
pull the mappings from the database which will format the database
connection URL. Note that we cannot simply update the sqlalchemy
RowProxy objects we get normally since those are read-only, and
because of how the mappings are used as objects with attribute
access rather than as a dict we cannot just convert the RowProxy
to a dict - we would have to put it in some kind of object for
attribute access and if we are going to do that we might as well
just use the CellMapping objects we have so that's what we do in
this change.

Change-Id: I5ce175517f6feb6e82ba507078a565b71427a4b0

commit_message:
Update CONTRIBUTING and HACKING

Update README.rst to not point to HACKING.rst, only CONTRIBUTING.rst.

Remove HACKING.rst because it is redundant in purpose, and incorrect
in content.

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst to point to the contributor docs on
docs.openstack.org and generally be a bit less generic than before.

Change-Id: Ib608b494e027091ae324793f275bad3b554e9710
Story: 2005190
Task: 29949
Task: 29950

subject: Suppress output from copy tasks
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 21:41:59.000000000', 'message': 'Suppress output from copy tasks

These tasks output the contents of the things being copied which can be
extra verbose and not beneficial to the overall process. These files can
be retrieved off the disk if necessary.

Change-Id: I2def6c41a1df345d055b6db26130cb6faf93be53
Related-Bug: #1819226
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress output from copy tasks

These tasks output the contents of the things being copied which can be
extra verbose and not beneficial to the overall process. These files can
be retrieved off the disk if necessary.

Change-Id: I2def6c41a1df345d055b6db26130cb6faf93be53
Related-Bug: #1819226

[{'created': '2019-03-01 17:17:54.000000000', 'message': "Use 'target_helper' config opt in linstor driver

All cinder config options named as 'iscsi_*' were renamed to
'target_*'.
The linstor driver was added after that change, hence still
fetches 'iscsi_helper' opt.
This patch replaces it with 'target_helper'.

Change-Id: I4543e80488cb079b763679886bbde9d1ada70333
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'target_helper' config opt in linstor driver

All cinder config options named as 'iscsi_*' were renamed to
'target_*'.
The linstor driver was added after that change, hence still
fetches 'iscsi_helper' opt.
This patch replaces it with 'target_helper'.

Change-Id: I4543e80488cb079b763679886bbde9d1ada70333

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-28 17:18:38.000000000', 'message': "VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265
(cherry picked from commit eefd8302b3a01fd5cff0169b6eca0588975ff244)

commit_message:
VNX: update sg in cache

When `destroy_empty_storage_group` is enabled, the sg will be deleted
after the last lun is detached from it. The issue is that the sg cache
isn't updated, which caused the failure of subsequent attaching volumes
to the same host because the sg in the cache will be used directly which
doesn't exist any more.

The fix is updating the sg with poll after deleting it. This doesn't
delete the sg from cache explicitly but makes sure the sg in cache with
latest status `not-exist`. Subsequent attaching will create the sg if it
is `not-exist`.

Closes-bug: #1817385
Change-Id: Ibb39879a77c97c6a5d885461e93116810d16b265
(cherry picked from commit eefd8302b3a01fd5cff0169b6eca0588975ff244)

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix multi-attach volume deletion

While deleting a multi-attached volume, all delete operations were
failing.

Change-Id: I67746e56125888983859774062c0eeceb60ea7be
Closes-bug: #1817611

commit_message:
Join on explcit relationship paths

The join() in get_router_for_floatingip() is joining from entity
to entity without an explicit ON clause which creates an ambiguous
situation.  SQLAlchemy 1.3 guards against this now, so use the
real relationship-bound path so that the ORM does not need to guess.

Closes-bug: #1819260
Change-Id: Ia377a9d1a32a78abdaee74c79e395acd77e486ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-11 15:48:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove publish-loci post job

The publishing credentials for this job are misconfigured in Zuul and
result in the whole post pipeline failing, which causes tarballs not to
be updated on tarballs.openstack.org[1]. Remove the misconfigured job to
get the post pipeline working again.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2019-03-11

Change-Id: I4d94a433ba32bce7ee926cdde487eeec980c6b8b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove publish-loci post job

The publishing credentials for this job are misconfigured in Zuul and
result in the whole post pipeline failing, which causes tarballs not to
be updated on tarballs.openstack.org[1]. Remove the misconfigured job to
get the post pipeline working again.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-release/%23openstack-release.2019-03-11

Change-Id: I4d94a433ba32bce7ee926cdde487eeec980c6b8b

commit_message:
Add support to deploy mistral

In additin to adding mistral role we also
include os-mistral-install.yml to deploy
mistral to the appropriate hosts.

Change-Id: I9c93e82ec655459c45baf91ed6e6130f2735f61f

commit_message:
Pin tempest to good hash when installed from source

[1] change in tempest needs keystone change [2], for
ubuntu keystone is installed from package while tempest
is installed from source. Until keystone commit is included
in ubuntu keystone package, let's pin tempest to good commit
when installed from source.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525244/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605851/

Change-Id: I995310d1277a79f8bf231e149c7bd6a9cc49bfba

LGTM, but I guess Jay want to get some feedback on his comment?'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-10-16 12:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'm still a -1 on this because I don't see how this gets used by nova really - this still hand-waves over how it would be used. Sure we can add more APIs to placement, but if we don't know how they are going to be used what's the point?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-16 20:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-16 20:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I realize I'm probably going to get slapped for saying "how does this work for nova" when it's a very specific placement API change, but regardless of that I don't see how the blazar use case is solved by this either because of my earlier comments about how you can't load via extension pre-request placement filters (which blazar would need to leverage this within nova). So if the vehicle to get to this is through nova, then it's nova-specific and needs details for that as well.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-16 20:59:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I'm still a -1 on this because I don't see how this gets used by
 > nova really - this still hand-waves over how it would be used. Sure
 > we can add more APIs to placement, but if we don't know how they
 > are going to be used what's the point?

Matt, did you see my response/review here?

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603352/3/specs/stein/approved/negative-aggregate-membership.rst@199

I didn't see any response from you so wondered if maybe you missed it..."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-10-17 01:57:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The change itself looks good, it is a good improvement to placement APIs, and yes, as mentioned in the alternative section, using aggregate is probably better than using tratis to represent group-like stuff. But, I still have questions about how it will be used, for example, I used either serivce like Blazar or specify some aggregates having specific licenses like mentioned in the spec. It seems that I still have to change every normal(don't want to be in these particular groups) flavor to include ``not in group xx`` to trigger the ``!``expression when calling placement for allocation_candidates, I'd say this makes not much difference than adding ``group_of`` for all available groups. User still have to do tons of works, and if they add a new group, it is likely that they have to update every flavor to deal with the new group. I think a more useful feature will be some specific expression that can support: If I specify this ``param`` get me candidates with(in) this kind of hosts, if I do not specify this, don't get me this kind of hosts.

Why I think of traits at first is that, I was hopping that service like Blazar can add some traits like ``CUSTOM_HIDDEN_BLAZAR_HOST`` and all requests with normal flavors will ignore hosts with this kind of tratis, only ``Blazar_Flavor`` with the request of this traits will get these hosts. This will make the users life much more easier, as they only have to update the particular flavors rather than all flavors if some group got modified."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Why I think of traits at first is that, I was hopping that service like Blazar can add some traits like ``CUSTOM_HIDDEN_BLAZAR_HOST`` and all requests with normal flavors will ignore hosts with this kind of tratis, only ``Blazar_Flavor`` with the request of this traits will get these hosts. This will make the users life much more easier, as they only have to update the particular flavors rather than all flavors if some group got modified.

The problem with that is encoding meaning into traits is a slippery slope (HIDDEN being the encoded meaning of the trait). Nova has to translate the request to know how to get allocation candidates from placement.

If we had a pre-request filter that knows about a specific scheduler hint (reservation_id?), then we could translate all requests to be either in or out of some aggregate. If you don't have a reservation_id, then you get a host outside the "forbidden" blazar host aggregate. If you have a reservation_id, then you get a host within the forbidden aggregate. That's not really much different from how blazar's nova scheduler filter works today though, right? That's also very config heavy and not dynamic enough for simply applying exclusion filters to host aggregates in nova. I keep thinking about the AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation filter and just having some way to put metadata on an aggregate to say it's either available for some type of request or not.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 18:14:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Matt, did you see my response/review here?

No I didn't see that. After reading it, none of it is mentioned in this spec, nor how it solves any of the specific nova uses that we've punted from other specs saying this one will fix those problems. I'm specifically thinking of the spec Tushar and others have been pushing for awhile:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593475/

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381912/

I believe at one time or another was said the former was a duplicate of the latter essentially, and Tushar wrote the traits one because at the first PTG in Denver we told him to solve the problem with traits, and then we told him later to use this forbidden aggregates concept, but this spec doesn't really explain how any of these nova use cases that this is supposed to solve will actually solve those other problems. I understand the API being proposed, it's simple enough, but I don't agree with just adding more new APIs when we don't actually have a plan for how we are going to leverage them to solve real problems."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-10-18 06:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-10-18 09:22:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

I have couple of questions inline but overall I'm not against this.
Cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-10-19 15:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I have only one issue left about numbered request groups.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-10-22 09:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-10-25 08:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-07 11:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

wfm'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-27 19:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

For completeness, Tushar's related spec that depends on this is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609960/

Maybe we should rebase that on top of this so the dependencies are clear."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-27 20:32:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Now that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609960/ is up and Tushar is happy with this to solve the problem he's been trying to solve (for years now) I'm happy to move forward with this, given it's admittedly useful on its own."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-11-28 09:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-12-05 02:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Spec: Support filtering by forbidden aggregate

This spec proposes to support negative filtering by the
underlying resource provider's membership.

Change-Id: I12d36993de58d75c639fc4eb3c9de6ad51d62b09
Blueprint: negative-aggregate-membership

(3 comments)

Probably good to get Jay to weight in here on the impact of a single SQL query that lists every instance uuid in the entire system, and how bad that would be.

I think that we probably need to provide some other way to do this than an online data migration so that we don't tank performance of that process with something that scans the entire database. Since this was just a pre-queens thing, maybe even just document a script or process to do this for people that have this situation?"}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-06-04 08:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2018-06-04 08:40:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Probably good to get Jay to weight in here on the impact of a
 > single SQL query that lists every instance uuid in the entire
 > system, and how bad that would be.

yep okay.

 > 
 > I think that we probably need to provide some other way to do this
 > than an online data migration so that we don't tank performance of
 > that process with something that scans the entire database. Since
 > this was just a pre-queens thing, maybe even just document a script
 > or process to do this for people that have this situation?

works for us :), will see if Matt and Melanie have any ideas, since it was during one of the cells meetings that we suggested to do this as an online migration."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-06 18:55:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I decided to use the instance_mapping for the following reasons in my logic:

1) leaving it as NULL is anyways a problem since the migration would try to fill that up unnecessarily.
2) The logic here requires a field for me to store the id of the last marked mapping for which all the other fields like (cell_id, project_id are filled leaving the user_id)

commit_message:
Delete orphaned RS and IM records of archived instances

Before Queens, request_specs and instance_mappings in nova_api DB are
not removed when an instance is archived. In Queens they are removed
when the instances are archived. However, for the deployments that
archived instances before running Queens they will have
request_specs and instance_mappings that are not associated to any
instance (they were already deleted). This patch introduces an
online migration tool to remove these orphaned records.

Change-Id: Iaef02e1451af8b8ec5d8a9cab36e416c61f9a01e
Closes-Bug: #1761198
